sudo systemctl restart redis-server.service
Job for redis-server.service failed because the control process exited with error code.
See "systemctl status redis-server.service" and "journalctl -xe" for details.
What can I do to be able to restart the service?

You can try to fix the error code by running the following command in a terminal window:

sudo systemctl status redis-server.service

This will give you information about the status of redis-server, including any error codes. If the error code is related to a problem with the service configuration, you can try to fix it by editing the configuration file for redis-server.

If the error code is not related to a problem with the service configuration, you may need to install missing dependencies or update your system configuration. You can try to resolve the issue by running the following commands:

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y redis-server

If these commands do not resolve the issue, you may need to look for more information about the error code and seek assistance from a system administrator or a support forum.

executing journalctl -xe it returns: -- A start job for unit redis-server.service has begun execution.
--
-- The job identifier is 4408.
May 16 08:14:52 web1 redis-server[3516]: *** FATAL CONFIG FILE ERROR ***
May 16 08:14:52 web1 redis-server[3516]: Reading the configuration file, at line 171
May 16 08:14:52 web1 redis-server[3516]: >>> 'logfile /var/log/redis/redis-server.log'
May 16 08:14:52 web1 redis-server[3516]: Can't open the log file: Permission denied
May 16 08:14:52 web1 systemd[1]: redis-server.service: Control process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILU
-- Subject: Unit process exited

Based on the error message, it appears that the Redis service is unable to open the log file due to permission issues. You may need to check the permissions on the log file and ensure that the user running the Redis service has permission to read and write to the file.

You can also try to resolve the issue by running the following commands:

sudo chown -R redis:redis /var/log/redis
sudo chmod -R 755 /var/log/redis

If these commands do not resolve the issue, you may need to look for more information about the error code and seek assistance from a system administrator or a support forum.
